subject: Math
title: Word Problems with Quadratics
description: Apply quadratic functions to real-world scenarios

content.text: Quadratic functions model many real-world situations: projectile motion, area problems, revenue and profit maximization, and more!

content.heading: Common Quadratic Applications
content.text:
• Projectile motion: h(t) = -16t² + v₀t + h₀
• Area problems: A = length × width
• Revenue: R = (price)(quantity sold)
• Optimization: find maximum or minimum values

content.heading: Example 1
content.problem: A ball is thrown upward with velocity 32 ft/s from height 6 ft. Its height is h(t) = -16t² + 32t + 6. What is the maximum height?
solution: Maximum height: 22 feet at t = 1 second

content.heading: Example 2
content.problem: A rectangular garden has perimeter 40m. If width is x, area is A = x(20-x). Find maximum area.

content.heading: Practice Problems
problems: For h(t) = -16t² + 48t, at what t is maximum height?
For h(t) = -16t² + 64t + 4, what is initial height?
If area A = x(30-x), at what x is A maximum?
If A = x(40-x), what is maximum area?
For R = -2x² + 80x, at what x is revenue maximum?
For P = -x² + 100x - 500, is there a max or min?
If h(t) = -16t² + 32t, when does object hit ground (h=0)?
If revenue R = -3x² + 60x, what is maximum R?
For h(t) = -16t² + 80t + 5, what is coefficient of t²?
